items.sentence: I'll never find a keyboard patch that actually sounds like an electric guitar.
I wanted to be a singer, but I was told that I should learn to play the drums.
It may never be known how we silly Anglophones got "baloney" out of "bologna."
Tom got out in front of the library and waited while Mary went to park the car.
Tom discovered that life on the road wasn\'t as easy as he thought it would be.
Tom isn\'t alone in thinking that Mary is the most beautiful girl in his class.
I imagine that Tom will eventually learn to deal with the way people treat him.
I can\'t figure out how to transfer MP3 files from my iPod back to my computer.
I wonder whether or not Tom has already told Mary she doesn\'t have to do that.
I wonder whether or not Tom has already told Mary she doesn\'t need to do that.
If Tom had been wearing his seat belt, he wouldn\'t have been injured so badly.
I\'d like to go through just one day without being told I look like my brother.
It\'s been raining heavily since this morning, so I don\'t want to go anywhere.
I like pigs. Dogs look up to us. Cats look down on us. Pigs treat us as equals.
I don\'t think I\'ll ever sound like a native speaker no matter how much I try.
If it looks like an apple and it tastes like an apple, it\'s probably an apple.
Tom wasn\'t looking at Mary, but he was listening to everything she was saying.
Tom and I could\'ve saved ourselves a lot of time by just doing that ourselves.
Tom assumed Mary was talking nonsense simply because he didn\'t understand her.
Tom apparently hasn\'t yet told Mary that he\'s planning to drop out of school.
There is a really good restaurant just off the beach that I think you\'d enjoy.
Tom can\'t stand the hot and muggy summers here, so he heads for the mountains.
Tom couldn\'t completely rule out the possibility that Mary had killed herself.
Tom was the driver of the car that crashed into the supermarket on Park Street.
When my uncle left for America, many people came to see him off at the airport.
Tom was a pretty good French teacher and I learned a lot from him very quickly.
Tom\'s mother used to wash his clothes for him, but now he washes them himself.
We\'ll be broke soon if we don\'t stop spending money on things we don\'t need.
Tom couldn\'t completely rule out the possibility that what Mary said was true.
Tom decided that it wasn\'t necessary to deal with that problem this afternoon.
Tom did the best he could, but he wasn\'t able to get a higher grade than Mary.
Tom didn\'t seem surprised when he heard that Mary and John had gotten married.
Tom should\'ve listened to you and bought that painting when he had the chance.
Tom stopped knocking on the door as soon as he realized that Mary wasn\'t home.
Tom thinks Mary should apologize to John for not doing what she said she\'d do.
Tom told the men sitting around the table that he\'d never played poker before.
Tom doesn\'t think it\'ll rain, but he plans to carry an umbrella just in case.
I know you well enough to know that you didn\'t really want to go out with Tom.
Tom told me that he could see no reason why he shouldn\'t accept Mary\'s offer.
I realize the effort you have put into this project and I really appreciate it.
I remember it as if it were yesterday, but in reality it was fifteen years ago.
I think what impressed me most was the way Tom could talk to just about anyone.
I wish I could take back all those terrible things I said about you last night.
Do you want a second opinion? I can get another doctor to come here right away.

I want to be able to walk down this street without worrying about getting shot.

Tom emptied the water out of the bottle before he refilled it with fresh water.
I can\'t believe that you wouldn\'t enjoy playing cards with me and my friends.
Tom isn\'t the only one who doesn\'t have enough money to buy something to eat.
